persian gulf: A semi-enclosed body of water in the Middle East, bounded by the eastern coast of the Arabian Peninsula and the western coast of Iran, where a vast array of marine life, including large aquatic organisms, inhabits its warm and nutrient-rich waters, which can occasionally be disrupted by climate cycles leading to mass blooms that impact local ecosystems and human activities.
